Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: MRF share price rises 2.25% in today's trading
content: MRF shares saw a gain of 2.25% with the price reaching Rs 144120.00 in Monday's session. The company's quarterly revenue shows a fluctuating trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,675.69 Crore, an increase compared to the Rs 7,074.82 Crore reported for the quarter-ending March 2025. The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was higher than the revenue for the quarter-ending December 2024, which stood at Rs 7,000.82 Crore. Lastly, the EPS for the quarter-ending September 2024 was lower than the EPS for the quarter-ending June 2024, which was Rs 1,346.38. The annual financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue. In 2025, the revenue was Rs 28,153.18 Crore compared to Rs 25,169.21 Crore in 2024. The revenue in 2024 was greater than the revenue in 2023, which stood at Rs 23,008.50 Crore. The revenue in 2023 was higher than the revenue in 2022, which was Rs 19,316.72 Crore. Also, the revenue in 2022 was greater than the revenue in 2021, which was Rs 16,163.19 Crore. However, the net profit saw a slight decrease in 2025. Similarly, the net profit in 2023 was higher than the net profit in 2022, which was Rs 669.24 Crore. Lastly, the net profit in 2022 was lower than the net profit in 2021, which was Rs 1,277.07 Crore. The EPS in 2025 was Rs 4,407.51, lower compared to Rs 4,907.24 in 2024. The EPS in 2024 was considerably higher than the EPS in 2023, which was Rs 1,813.10. The EPS in 2023 was greater than the EPS in 2022, which was Rs 1,577.97. The EPS in 2022 was lower than the EPS in 2021, which was Rs 3,011.14. The BVPS in 2025 was Rs 43,604.86 compared to Rs 39,394.25 in 2024. The BVPS in 2024 was higher than the BVPS in 2023, which was Rs 34,688.25. The BVPS in 2023 was higher than the BVPS in 2022, which was Rs 33,094.10. Similarly, the BVPS in 2022 was greater than the BVPS in 2021, which was Rs 31,636.34. The ROE in 2025 stood at 10.11 compared to 12.46 in 2024. The ROE in 2024 was significantly higher than the ROE in 2023, which was 5.22. The ROE in 2023 was greater than the ROE in 2022, which was 4.76. The ROE in 2022 was lower than the ROE in 2021, which was 9.52. The debt to equity ratio in 2025 was 0.16 compared to 0.12 in 2024. The debt to equity ratio in 2024 was lower than the debt to equity ratio in 2023, which was 0.17. The debt to equity ratio in 2023 was lower than the debt to equity ratio in 2022, which was 0.20. title: Global Health shares rise 2.09% in today's trading
content: Shares of Global Health were trading higher at Rs 1,402.70, a gain of 2.09% in Monday's session. The stock is among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index as of 1:55 pm. Financial Performance: Global Health's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The company's revenue has increased steadily over the past few years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 3,692.32 Crore, compared to Rs 3,275.11 Crore in the previous year and Rs 2,694.25 Crore in 2023. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 481.32 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 478.06 Crore reported in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) also saw a marginal increase, rising to Rs 17.92 in March 2025 from Rs 17.80 in the previous year. Key financial ratios for Global Health include a P/E ratio of 69.75 and a P/B ratio of 9.20 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.10 as of the year-ending March 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,402.70, Global Health has seen a gain of 2.09% in today's session and is among the gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Jubilant Pharmova Announces Resignation of Key Management Personnel
content: Jubilant Pharmova announced the resignations of Dr. Ramakrishnan Arul, Whole-Time Director, and Dr. Tushar Gupta, Chief of Operations- Contract Research, Development, and Manufacturing Organization (CRDMO) Business. Both resignations are effective at the close of business hours on August 31, 2025. The departures are attributed to their transfer to Jubilant Biosys Limited, a subsidiary, where they will take on new roles starting September 1, 2025. The company stated that it has complied with disclosure requirements under Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations, adhering to SEBI Master Circular No. SEBI/HO/CFD/PoD2/CIR/P/0155 dated November 11, 2024. title: From today, listed firms must provide granular disclosures for related party transactions
content: Starting today, nearly 5,000 listed companies will be required to follow a new set of rules issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) for approval of related party transactions (RPTs). The framework, which becomes effective September 1, is aimed at bringing greater transparency and equipping shareholders with more detailed information to make informed decisions. Related party transactions are business dealings between a company and entities that share a pre-existing relationship—such as subsidiaries, key management personnel, or major shareholders. These dealings often raise governance concerns if not adequately disclosed, as they may result in conflicts of interest or potential misuse of company resources. In June this year, Sebi directed listed entities to adopt minimum disclosure standards as prescribed by the Industry Standards Forum (ISF), a body comprising representatives from industry chambers like FICCI, CII, and ASSOCHAM, working in collaboration with the regulator and stock exchanges. These standards mandate that companies share detailed information with audit committees and shareholders before seeking approval for RPT proposals. Also read: Sebi panel recommends open offer process may be faster with quicker payout to investors Greater clarity and explanatory statements According to Makarand M Joshi, Founder of MMJC & Associates, “Explanatory statements for approving material RPTs need to be made more self-explanatory. It shall contain information, not only meeting but significantly exceeding the requirements of the Companies Act, 2013 viz. Data placed before audit committee, pricing methodology, certification from KMP, QR code for report of any etc.” He further noted that drafting such explanatory statements will now require far more diligence to enable better informed shareholder decision-making. The ISF-prescribed format specifies that management must present details of related parties’ shareholding or contribution to profit and loss of the listed entity or its subsidiary, both directly and indirectly. Likewise, shareholding of the related party in the listed entity must also be disclosed.In addition, information such as the financial performance of the related party, details of past transactions, and specifics of the proposed transaction—including nature, size, and rationale—must be clearly laid out. Wide coverage of transactions The new rules go beyond generic disclosures. For instance, transactions relating to loans, inter-corporate deposits, advances, or investments by the listed entity or its subsidiaries must now be accompanied by details of source of funds and rationale. Similarly, any proposed guarantee, indemnity, or comfort letter given by a company or subsidiary must be explained with the reasoning behind it. If transactions involve borrowings, sale, lease, or disposal of assets of subsidiaries or units, then audit committees must also be provided with bidding details and information about bidders.When it comes to royalty payments, the requirements are even more extensive. Companies will have to disclose the purpose of royalty paid during the last three years, break up payments made for brand use, technology know-how, professional or management fees, and compare royalty growth rates with growth in turnover, profit after tax, and dividends. Firms will also need to provide evidence of benefits derived from technology transfers and compare their royalty outgo with industry peers. Also read: Is Sebi revisiting F&O suitability? Recent remarks indicate entry criteria discussion is back on table and here's how it could look Sebi’s study on royalty payments Sebi had earlier conducted a comprehensive study of royalty payments across 233 listed companies between FY14 and FY23. The regulator found several instances where firms paid royalty to related parties exceeding 20% of their net profits. Alarmingly, even loss-making firms were making royalty pay-outs. The study revealed 1,538 instances of royalty payments falling below the 5% turnover approval threshold, while 185 cases involved loss-making companies paying a cumulative Rs 1,355 crore as royalty. Sebi observed that such practices raised questions on governance and shareholder value. Certification to protect shareholders Under the new framework, companies must also provide certifications from the CEO, CFO, or other key managerial personnel, and from every promoter-director, confirming that the proposed RPTs are not prejudicial to public shareholders. If any promoter-director fails to provide such certification, the fact must be disclosed to the audit committee and shareholders before approval.Pavan Vijay, Founder, Corporate Professionals says, “The RPT Industry Standards enhance investor confidence by ensuring greater transparency and comparability in related party disclosures at the time of approval. Investors can now better assess the fairness of transactions involving promoters or key stakeholders, identify governance lapses and benchmark disclosures across companies and industries”. He further says, “Professionals should ensure consistency with the structured format specified in Para 4 of the RPT Industry Standards, clearly disclose transaction terms, avoid vague or incomplete information and provide valuation or other external reports to the Audit Committee and shareholders (through a QR code or web-link), among other requirements”. Anjali Malhotra, Partner- Regulatory, Nangia Andersen LLP  says, "The requirement to have standardized formats for approval of RPT’s emerged due to precedents wherein funds were diverted through related parties for personal use and information was camouflaged which could have enabled the audit committee o or shareholders to judiciously accord their approvals. The historic examples depict how gaps in transparency can disrupt stakeholders trust, threat business continuity and invite regulatory actions". Transparency and compliance The regulator had initially set July 1, 2025, as the effective date for the circular. However, based on industry feedback, the implementation was deferred to September 1 to allow companies more time to align their systems and processes. With the new rules now coming into force, experts believe Indian capital markets are poised to see stronger governance practices. By ensuring that shareholders receive more granular information, Sebi aims to reduce opacity in related party dealings and enhance investor confidence. Additionally, Sebi has proposed easing related party transaction rules by raising shareholder approval threshold to Rs 5,000 crore and waiving disclosures for deals below Rs 15 crore. The consultation paper issued last month proposes to simplify compliance, boost transparency, and strengthen corporate governance norms.

title: Berger Paints India shares rise 2.03%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Berger Paints India shares gained 2.03% to trade at Rs 543.80 in Monday's session, emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. This increase reflects a positive movement from its previous close. Regarding the company's financial performance, Berger Paints India has demonstrated consistent growth in both revenue and net profit over the past five years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 11,544.71 Crore, compared to Rs 11,198.92 Crore for the year ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,147.75 Crore, up from Rs 1,128.80 Crore in the previous year. Here is a summary of Berger Paints India's key financial data:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20216,817.59725.337.4134.8421.310.1120228,761.78829.098.5840.5021.200.17202310,567.84873.578.8646.3519.120.17202411,198.921,128.8010.0246.2321.700.04202511,544.711,147.7510.1352.7819.180.02The company's revenue saw an increase of 3.1% from Rs 11,198.92 Crore in 2024 to Rs 11,544.71 Crore in 2025. Net profit also increased by 1.68%, from Rs 1,128.80 Crore in 2024 to Rs 1,147.75 Crore in 2025. The earnings per share (EPS) increased from Rs 10.02 in March 2024 to Rs 10.13 in March 2025. Here is a summary of Berger Paints India's key financial data on quarterly basis:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20243,091.01344.413.03Sep 20242,774.61261.042.31Dec 20242,975.06288.732.53Mar 20252,704.03253.572.25Jun 20253,200.76303.872.70The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 3,200.76 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 303.87 Crore with an EPS of Rs 2.70. In comparison, for the quarter ending June 2024, the revenue was Rs 3,091.01 Crore, the net profit was Rs 344.41 Crore and the EPS was Rs 3.03. Berger Paints India announced a final dividend of Rs 3.80 per share on May 14, 2025, with an effective date of August 5, 2025. Other corporate actions include a 1:5 bonus ratio on August 9, 2023 (ex-bonus date: September 22, 2023) and a stock split (2:1) on November 4, 2014 (ex-split date: January 8, 2015). Moneycontrol analysis indicates very bearish sentiment on the stock as of September 1, 2025.

title: Eicher Motors' August 2025 Sales Surge 55% to 1,14,002 Units
content: Eicher Motors (EICHERMOT) August Motorcycle Sales Surge 55% Y-o-Y Eicher Motors reported a 55% year-on-year increase in total motorcycle sales for August 2025, reaching 1,14,002 units. Exports for the month grew by 39% to 11,126 units, indicating sustained international demand. In August 2025, sales of models with engine capacity up to 350cc reached 98,631 units, a 61% increase compared to 61,087 units in August 2024. Models exceeding 350cc saw sales of 15,371 units, a 23% rise from 12,542 units last year. August 2025 Sales Data (Units Sold) ParticularsAug-25Aug-24% ChangeModels with engine capacity upto 350cc98,63161,08761%Models with engine capacity exceeding 350cc15,37112,54223%Total1,14,00273,62955%International Business (included in the total above)11,1268,00639% Year-to-Date Sales Data (Units Sold) ParticularsApr-25 to Aug-25Apr-24 to Aug-24% ChangeModels with engine capacity upto 350cc4,02,1323,11,86029%Models with engine capacity exceeding 350cc65,44355,94117%Total4,67,5753,67,80127%International Business (included in the total above)59,66636,28464% B. Govindarajan, Managing Director, noted that the August performance indicates positive momentum heading into the festive season, a period typically associated with increased domestic demand. The continued strength in exports was also highlighted. Brand & Business Updates Royal Enfield launched the 2025 Hunter 350 in a new Graphite Grey colorway, complementing existing options like Rio White and Dapper Grey. This variant features a matte, minimalistic design with neon yellow accents. The company also introduced a new Shadow Ash colorway for the Guerrilla 450, priced at INR 2,49,000 (ex-showroom, Chennai). This edition features an olive-green tank with blacked-out detailing and the Tripper Dash. Motoverse 2025 will be held in Goa from November 21-23, 2025. Royal Enfield also announced the first edition of Himalayan Spirit, an off-road experience for Himalayan riders at BigRock Dirt Park in Kolar. Season 5 of Art of Motorcycling, themed Cine-Verse, invites artists from 12 countries to design movie posters featuring themselves and their Royal Enfield motorcycles. The company recently unveiled its new city+ motorcycle brand - the Flying Flea - a fresh take on urban mobility, blending authentic design with advanced technology.

title: Varun Beverages Announces Senior Management Change
content: Varun Beverages (VBL) announced a senior management change, effective August 31, 2025. According to a regulatory filing on September 1, 2025, Mr. Vikas Bhatia, Executive Director - Group ESG Head (Non-Board Member), has resigned from his position. The company stated that the disclosures are in compliance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. title: Mahindra Auto Sales Flat at 75,901 Vehicles in August 2025
content: Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M Ltd) reports August 2025 auto sales at 75,901 vehicles, showing flat growth including exports. Utility Vehicle segment sees domestic sales of 39,399 units, reflecting a -9% de-growth. Total Utility Vehicle sales, including exports, reach 40,846 units. Commercial Vehicle domestic sales stand at 22,427 units. Nalinikanth Gollagunta, CEO, Automotive Division, M&M Ltd, notes "August witnessed robust demand in the SUV segment amidst GST rate anticipation. Mahindra reported 7.4% YoY growth in PV Vahan registrations. Commercial vehicles saw 16% YoY growth (<7.5T LCV category)." Gollagunta added, "Ahead of the final GST announcement, wholesale billing was consciously reduced to minimize dealer stock. The company anticipates GST rationalisation to drive demand through the festive season. Total vehicle sales mirror last year's figures at 75,901 units, while SUV sales declined -9% YoY to 39,399 units." Mahindra holds leadership positions in farm equipment, utility vehicles, IT, and financial services in India and stands as the world's largest tractor company by volume. It also maintains a strong presence in renewable energy, agriculture, logistics, hospitality, and real estate. The Mahindra Group focuses on ESG leadership, rural prosperity, and urban living. title: Gujarat Gas shares rise 2.78%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Gujarat Gas experienced a rise of 2.78% to Rs 431.10 in Monday's session, with the stock emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 1:37 pm, the stock was trading positively compared to its previous close. On August 31, 2025, the company made an announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR) regarding newspaper publication. Gujarat Gas is set to convene its 13th Annual General Meeting on September 25, 2025, at 3:00 P.M. through VC/OAVM, according to a notice issued on August 30, 2025. The company’s Business Responsibility and Sustainability Report, along with the BRSR Assurance Report of BRSR Core for the financial year 2024-25, was reported on August 30, 2025. Gujarat Gas had a stock split where the old face value of Rs 10 was split to a new face value of Rs 2. The exsplit date was January 15, 2019 and the record date was January 16, 2019. The company has consistently distributed dividends. On May 19, 2025, a final dividend of Rs 5.82 per share (291%) was announced, effective September 4, 2025. title: Dixon Technologies shares surge 4.91% amid high volume trading on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Dixon Technologies gained 4.91% to trade at Rs 17,509.00 in Monday's session, driven by high volume and unusual trading activity. The consolidated annual revenue has increased significantly, with sales rising from Rs 6,448.17 Crore in 2021 to Rs 38,860.10 Crore in 2025. Net profit also saw a substantial increase from Rs 159.79 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,215.20 Crore in 2025. title: M&M shares among top gainers on Nifty 50, up 3.73%
content: Shares of M&M gained 3.73% to trade at Rs 3,318.90 in Monday's session, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index at 1:30 pm. Other top gainers on Nifty 50 were Bajaj Auto, Hero Motocorp, Trent and Tata Motors. Financial Snapshot: M&M's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 45,529.19 Crore, compared to Rs 42,599.31 Crore in March 2025, Rs 41,470.05 Crore in December 2024, Rs 37,923.74 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 37,217.72 Crore in June 2024. The company's net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,898.44 Crore, up from Rs 3,102.48 Crore in March 2025, Rs 3,317.22 Crore in December 2024, Rs 2,894.71 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 3,221.34 Crore in June 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 36.58, compared to Rs 29.52 in March 2025, Rs 28.51 in December 2024, Rs 28.43 in September 2024 and Rs 29.44 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 158,749.75 Crore, compared to Rs 138,279.30 Crore in 2024, Rs 121,268.55 Crore in 2023, Rs 90,170.57 Crore in 2022, and Rs 74,277.78 Crore in 2021. The company's net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 12,535.75 Crore, up from Rs 11,148.39 Crore in 2024, Rs 9,869.04 Crore in 2023, Rs 5,397.22 Crore in 2022 and Rs 2,425.26 Crore in 2021. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 115.91, compared to Rs 101.14 in 2024, Rs 92.41 in 2023, Rs 59.20 in 2022 and Rs 16.33 in 2021. title: MMTC to Hold 62nd AGM on September 26, 2025
content: MMTC Sets Date for 62nd AGM on September 26, 2025; To Be Held Via Video Conferencing MMTC Limited announced that its 62nd Annual General Meeting (AGM) will convene on September 26, 2025. In line with regulatory guidelines, the meeting will be conducted via Video Conferencing (VC) and Other Audio-Visual Means (OAVM), as per the Companies Act, 2013, and directives from the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) and SEBI. The AGM is scheduled for 11:30 AM (IST) and will be accessible from the company's registered office at Core-1, 'SCOPE Complex', 7 Institutional Area, Lodhi Road, New Delhi-110003. Key Agenda Items: Shareholders will address the following key business items: Review and adoption of the company's Financial Statements for the year ending March 31, 2025, alongside the Directors' Report, Statutory Auditors' Report, and Secretarial Auditor's Report.Granting authority to the Board of Directors for the appointment and remuneration of Statutory/Branch Auditors for the financial year 2025-26.Decision regarding filling the vacancy resulting from the retirement of Smt. Arti Bhatnagar.Appointment of M/s. BLAK & Co. as Secretarial Auditors.Appointment of Smt. Aishvarya Singh as a Non-Executive Director, Government Nominee Director.Appointment of Shri Dinesh Dubey as an Independent Director.Appointment of Shri Nitin Kumar Yadav as CMD.Appointment of Smt. Anoopa Sankarankutty Nair as Director (Finance). Participation and Voting: Shareholders can participate in the AGM using the VC/OAVM facility provided by Central Depository Services Ltd. (CDSL). Access will be available 15 minutes before and after the scheduled start time. The company is facilitating electronic voting for members, both remotely and during the AGM. Remote e-voting commences on September 22, 2025, at 9:00 AM and concludes on September 25, 2025, at 5:00 PM. Important Dates: The Register of Members and Share Transfer books will be closed from September 20, 2025, to September 26, 2025, inclusive. The AGM notice and the Annual Report for 2024-25 are being disseminated electronically to members with registered email addresses. These documents will also be accessible on the company's website and the CDSL website. The 62nd AGM will be conducted via VC/OAVM.

title: Tube Investments of India shares surge 4.81% amid high volume; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Tube Investments of India Ltd's stock price jumped 4.81% to Rs 3,104.20 in Monday's session, witnessing a surge in volume and emerging as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. The stock experienced a notable increase, reflecting positive investor interest. The company's financial performance reveals a steady increase in revenue over the past few quarters. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,309.06 Crore, up from Rs 5,149.96 Crore in March 2025, Rs 4,812.22 Crore in December 2024, Rs 4,924.55 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 4,577.92 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 303.28 Crore, compared to Rs 158.22 Crore in March 2025. On an annual basis, the company's revenue has also shown substantial growth. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 19,464.65 Crore, compared to Rs 16,890.33 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,054.67 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 1,187.51 Crore reported in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Tube Investments of India show a basic EPS of Rs 34.83 and diluted EPS of Rs 34.80 as of March 2025. The company reported a book value per share of Rs 286.08 as of the year-ending March 2025. The following table summarizes the key financial performance indicators:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 20216,083.29304.6915.13Mar 202212,525.30994.3139.89Mar 202314,964.731,177.9849.50Mar 202416,890.331,187.5162.12Mar 202519,464.651,054.6734.83The company has also announced dividends. A final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) was announced on May 15, 2025, with an effective date of July 25, 2025. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (200%) was announced on February 3, 2025, and was effective from February 7, 2025. Tube Investments of India is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. With the stock's price surge to Rs 3,104.20, Tube Investments of India demonstrates strong market activity and financial growth.

title: Kamdhenu Ltd Board to Consider ₹0.25 Dividend, Reappointments on Sept 25
content: Kamdhenu Limited's board to convene its 31st Annual General Meeting September 25, 2025, via video conference to deliberate on key agenda items, including a proposed final dividend. Key items for consideration include: Audited financial statements for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025Reports from both auditors and the board of directorsProposed declaration of a final dividend for FY25Appointment of a director to succeed Shri Saurabh Agarwal, who is retiring by rotationRe-appointment of Shri Satish Kumar Agarwal as Chairman & Managing DirectorRe-appointment of Shri Sunil Kumar Agarwal as Whole-Time DirectorRe-appointment of Shri Sachin Agarwal as Whole-Time DirectorRe-appointment of Shri Baldev Raj Sachdeva as an Independent Director for a second termAppointment of M/s. Chandrasekaran Associates as Secretarial Auditors The board will review a proposal to declare a final dividend of ₹0.25 per equity share (@ 25%) with a face value of ₹1 each, fully paid up, for the fiscal year 2024-25. The record date is set for Thursday, September 18, 2025. The AGM will also address the re-appointment of Shri Satish Kumar Agarwal as Chairman & Managing Director. His proposed remuneration is outlined below: Proposed Remuneration for Shri Satish Kumar AgarwalPeriodRemunerationApril 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027₹40,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2027 to March 31, 2028₹45,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2028 to March 31, 2029₹50,00,000 per month In addition to the base remuneration, he is eligible for perks and benefits, including reimbursement for telephone bills, car repairs, driver salary, fuel expenses, and periodicals, capped at ₹1,00,000 per month, effective April 1, 2026. Shareholders will also consider the re-appointment of Shri Sunil Kumar Agarwal as a Whole-Time Director. His proposed remuneration is detailed in the table below: Proposed Remuneration for Shri Sunil Kumar AgarwalPeriodRemunerationApril 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027₹40,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2027 to March 31, 2028₹45,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2028 to March 31, 2029₹50,00,000 per month Besides the stated remuneration, he will also be entitled to perks and other benefits up to ₹1,00,000 per month, effective April 1, 2026, covering expenses such as telephone, car maintenance, driver salary, and fuel. The re-appointment of Shri Sachin Agarwal as a Whole-Time Director will also be up for consideration, with his remuneration as follows: Proposed Remuneration for Shri Sachin AgarwalPeriodRemunerationApril 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027₹40,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2027 to March 31, 2028₹45,00,000 per monthApril 1, 2028 to March 31, 2029₹50,00,000 per month Similar to the other directors, Shri Sachin Agarwal will receive perks capped at ₹1,00,000 monthly, commencing April 1, 2026. Shri Baldev Raj Sachdeva's re-appointment as an Independent Director for a subsequent five-year term, from May 2, 2026, to May 1, 2031, will also be considered. The AGM will also address the appointment of M/s. Chandrasekaran Associates as Secretarial Auditors for a 5-year term, auditing from FY 2025-26 to FY 2029-30. The firm will receive annual remuneration of ₹4,00,000, plus reimbursement of audit-related expenses as agreed with the board, for permissible services under relevant laws. Shareholders are encouraged to participate remotely in the video conference meeting.
